FOUND IN: Milliyen - A unit representing one-thousandth of a Japanese yen, not exactly one-hundredth but related to fractions of the yen.
Mobile - easily movable or capable of movement
Venus - The most prominent and widely known Roman goddess of love, beauty, sex, and fertility
Carbolic acid (phenol-based, historically significant as a disinfectant and antiseptic agent)
Bjorn Borg (tennis legend, no Abba member)
Cafe - A small restaurant offering light meals, coffee, tea, pastries or other beverages.
Keyboard - Although primarily associated with computers, "keyboard" metaphorically starts with the idea of pressing keys or unlocking digital information.
Hula - A traditional Hawaiian dance often performed to accompany hula music and telling stories or legends.
Elicit - call or draw out a response, reply, or reaction.
Radium (Ra) - Discovered in 1898 and became famous due to its radioactive properties.
Tapioca pudding (made from tapioca starch which is often creamy in consistency)
